page.title: 06ROAD AND RAIL TRANSPORT
page.content: There is only one bit of main road in our block, a few metres of the A52 from Boston to Skegness. There is a Lincolnshire Road Car bus service from Boston to Skegness, which passes through Freiston and Butterwick. Occasionally British Rail runs the buses because the trains to Skegness start and end late at night and early in the morning. The railway is outside our block. The 5 Bells in Butterwick was originally built as a station but the railway never arrived. There is a private bus service running once a day from Fishtoft to Boston by Hogg International Coaches. Buses also run to the Secondary Schools and Butterwick Primary School. All minor roads going East-West have to head for the bridges across the Hob Hole Drain, which crosses our block.
